answers.answer: Hi there.  While that 140 is elevated, that isn't super high blood pressure.  The bottom number at 100 or above is more concerning when that happens.  I would just prop your feet up, rest, take it easy and see if this helps.  If you get a bad headache or see spots, then call.  But I had bouts of this with occasional dizziness and seeing spots and would rest and it would improve.  I never got preeclampsia but had pregnancy hypertension throughout my pregnancy.If you are super worried, call your doctor's number for the after hours number to call and talk to them.  They can guide you.good luck
Keep a eye on your BP because mine started at 140/87 and it kept going up.

question: I'm 35 weeks and was just sent home from work for almost passing out, the checked my blood pressure and it was 140/80 (it's never gone over 120/80) I haven't been able to eat full meals layely. Could that cause my blood pressure to elevate or should I go get checked out.
title: Elevated blood pressure
